body: Looks good, failure is unrelated. I'll test and merge
Thank you, again! :)
@anupam128 Ready for a second review. Thanks!
@anupam128 I've done a pass.
@anupam128 I've done a pass.
@jwang98052 I've done a pass.
@afchung I've done a pass.
@afchung @markusweimer I have made the changes.
@markusweimer Addressed your comments, please have another look. Thanks!
Looks good. Have you done any E2E tests?

@afchung I don't have a way to do E2E test yet (HadoopFileSystem does not have GetFileStatus API)

REEF-922 with include this E2E testing.
@anupam128 OK, I'll test and merge after @markusweimer signs off.
Have addressed review comments and pushed in.
It looks good to me. I will test and merge this.
@dongjoon-hyun Thanks!
It looks good to me and passed tests on Windows. I'll merge this.

@johnyangk , could you review this? After the previous discussion with you, I'm trying to find a way to get slaveInfo from Mesos. Please refer https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-960 . I tested with various Mesos versions from 0.21 to 0.25 for both 0.21 and 0.25 dependancies.
Thank you, @johnyangk .
I did another pass, left a comment. Other than that: +1 on merging.

@dongjoon-hyun I've just noticed that the FailedEvaluatorHandler test only tests that the event is sent to the .NET side, but it doesn't actually verify that the Driver received the FailedEvaluator Event itself. I've filed REEF-969 to address this.
Oh, I misunderstood, too. I thought that's enough to achieve the goal. Then, I'm looking forward to see PR for REEF-969 soon.
@dongjoon-hyun Created PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/653. Thanks!
I will test and merge.
Correction: One of the files needs to stay. I will correct that during the merge.
Thank you, @markusweimer .
@dongjoon-hyun Ready for a second review. Thanks!
The failure seems unrelated to the change at hand. I will merge.
It looks good to me, and I'm testing now.
Thank you!
I'll merge this.
Doing another pass.
I'm done with my pass.
I will test and merge

We decided to move all .NET builds into MSBuild. Also, MSBuild triggers the maven build, not the other way around. The reason for that is that REEF.NET depends on REEF Java, but not the other way around.
@afchung @markusweimer thanks for reviewing. I have made the change.
I completed my pass.
I'll test and merge.
Thanks all! I have responded to comments and made changes.

There's one more change Visual Studio does automatically whenever it tries to build this:

--- a/lang/cs/.nuget/NuGet.Config
+++ b/lang/cs/.nuget/NuGet.Config

```
-  <packageSources>
-      <add key="NuGet official package source" value="https://nuget.org/api/v2/" />
-  </packageSources>
-  <disabledPackageSources />
   <activePackageSource>
-      <add key="All" value="(Aggregate source)"  />
+      <add key="All" value="(Aggregate source)" />
   </activePackageSource>
```

Is this something we want to add as well?
Do we need XUnit packages for non unittest projects?
I have taken a look.

Oh, I see. You mean I need to use `msbuild /target:Clean` to clean up the msbuild output.
Thank you. Now, I understand more. I will close this issue and Jira.
It looks good to me. I'll test and merge this.

We don't need xUnit packages for packages which don't have unittests, but I'm not sure that in the future we won't add tests to packages which don't currently have them... I guess we can limit current xUnit installations to the projects which currently have tests.
Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.Wake.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.Network.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.IO.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests
Org.Apache.REEF.Client.Tests
@jwang98052 Looks good in general. Only minor comments. Thanks!
@anupam128 One final nitpick from me. I'm +1 after. Thanks!
@afchung thanks! Made the change.
@afchung I have addressed review comments and pushed in the change.

This is a quick fix for `ValidateSuccessForLocalRuntime`. We need to investigate why a few tests make FailedEvaluators due to Netty exception sometimes. In case of `TestBridgeClient`, it makes NPE always according to the log.
This is an immature PR trying to embrace the current results of testsuite. It's okay to close this without merging.
@markusweimer Updated
I have done a quick pass. Changes LGTM. Hopefully this can be committed quickly before we have too many conflicts.
@zerg-junior I'll test and merge.
@dongjoon-hyun I don't think we should try to mask the test failures.

We need an instruction somewhere at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/REEF/Contributing regarding how to detect StyleCop issues, like we do for Checkstyle and Findbugs. Right now I would expect this change to enforce spacing rules, but there is no error or warning during build when I violate a spacing rule on purpose.
Looks good, I'll test and merge.
I'm +1 merging it.
+1 on merging. Can someone confirm to have run tests on this?
Thank you, @anupam128 and @tcNickolas .
@tcNickolas , we have a Nu.Get to make the violations as build errors. I will include that.
Rebased.
Looks good in general. Any possibility to put those in a prop file at root folder then import in test's csproj file?
+1 for merge
Sorry, pushed to wrong branch, will revert.
Reverted.

@tcNickolas , Now, StyleCop makes build errors. The positions of importing StyleCop are changed according to the following documents.

https://stylecop.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Setting%20Up%20StyleCop%20MSBuild%20Integration&referringTitle=Documentation
OK, I'll test and merge tomorrow.
I am wondering why the import in build.props doesn't work. I am fine with this approach though.

Yes, I think so. But it should be behind of 

```
<Import Project="$(MSBuildToolsPath)\Microsoft.CSharp.targets" />
```

. If not, it doesn't activate on builds. Please refer the link.
@afchung Thanks for the PR! I'll take a look.
Anyway, thank you for review, @anupam128 . It's a long and tedious PR.

Overall this looks great! I've left some minor comments, and I have one question. You made callback handlers as Collection, but I'm little bit curious there would be a case when user register multiple callbacks to a Tasklet. Could you kindly provide an example you think? Or did you aim at making it optional?

@yunseong You're right, it's probably better to provide a single callback, and the user can manage their own threads there. I'll address your comments.
Also, sorry, but I somehow named the branch REEF-503 instead of REEF-505, hope that is fine when you merge, or I can close this PR and create a new one with the correct branch name.
@afchung and I just spoke, he tested this code on Azure. I will merge it.

This doesn't build for me. @afchung Can you have a look?

The build fails due to missing metadata files for DLLs. Likely abuild order issue.
I've opted to close this PR and open a new one at https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/665, with comments addressed. Please have another look there instead. Thanks!
This is a new PR for https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/662 to fix branch naming.
@markusweimer I was able to build it on a new clone. What were your build errors?
@dongjoon-hyun That makes sense. Thanks for making the change.
The build errors are irrelevant to this PR. It looks good to me. I'll test and merge this.
I'll take a look at this.
Thank you, @afchung .
Looks good. Do we have a TODO item associated with removing the `LocalAddressProviderFactory`? When was it deprecated?
Tagging @tcNickolas to see if she knows anything about the deprecation of this class.
I'm not sure it makes a lot of sense to fight automatically generated project files. And then there might be issues with the order of imports. I'd rather keep it as is

When I searched, it's in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-552 . (Since 0.11)
And, I'm working on removing all Wake deprecated logs before next release.
I was just going to write that :-) It's been deprecated since 0.11, and it's great to see a volunteer to handle it!
Sounds good, I'll test and merge this PR then. Are we going to allow for another release before removing the class?

We can delete it as soon as all references to it are removed from our code. If we mark class as deprecated in release X, we can delete it in release X+1. If we delete it now, it will be part of 0.14, which is more than 1 release later than 0.11
Oh, this PR is just deleting the usage of `LocalAddressProviderFactory` to remove maven build warnings.
Do you mean delete `LocalAddressProviderFactory` itself?
Yes. I was wondering since we didn't specify a deprecation version in the JavaDocs previously.

As @tcNickolas mentioned, I think we can delete `LocalAddressProviderFactory`, too.
Am I right?
NuGet has good automation with UI and PowerShell. I agree with @tcNickolas to let automatically generated things as they are.
I see after this PR there is still one use of LocalAddressProviderFactory, in NameServerImpl. Could you fix that too, and delete the class?
@dongjoon-hyun In that case, it would be great if you can modify the JIRA item and commit comments accordingly. I'll test and merge after that. Thanks!
Seems like our builds are a bit unstable... for another PR I had to build 3 times before actually succeeding.
I will try on the command line and see whether that works. If it does, I will merge.
@afchung and @tcNickolas . I can do that. Thank you for improving this PR. I will update from JIRA.
